intro: Pleiarina glandulosa, commonly known as the glandular pleiarina, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and showy, pale yellow to white flowers. It typically grows in moist, tropical or subtropical environments. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for studies in plant morphology and ecological adaptation.
